186012560.review:
Idk, I really gave it a try. But I can't say this game is for me. Just like Maple Story, too many windows, too many hot keys to memorize. Too many annoying alters about things that do not involve you learning to play the game.

Biggest bummer is the Hit point system. I get a character can wound you as a status effect to hinder your combat and make it more difficult. But the fact you can't heal in combat if you are wounded. You cannot use a first aid on yourself when in combat is not how I like to play my MMO RPGS. Top it off the cost of items in the game if you just want to explore are kind of high. You need 10 bandages to fix your wounded status that is 500 gold coins. Your enemies maybe drop 50 coins but mostly useless crafting stuff.

When trying to do the main quests to level up my skills. What irked me... I cannoy say annoy but it get frustrating and angering is all the filler trash dialog in the game that really has nothing to do with story or your development. I had to Alt+F4 a few times because the dialog got so frustrating along with the constant announcements about different things and quest reminders.

Idk for a free to play game it is well made I guess, but for me, looking for an online MMO that lets me do whatever... This game isn't it. This game is frustrating in all the wrong ways from how you move around, to the combat, to the need to learn every stupid thing in order to progress slightly.

This game is an easy 2 out of 10 for me. Straight up thumbs down.

185567404.review:
Ignore my playtime- I've played this game off steam since it's beta nearly 20 years ago (2003!) 

This game looks like a ps1 games yes, however it's one of the most incredible MMO's you'll ever play imo, I've tried many and none quite match Mabinogi's freedom of playstyle, aesthetic, vibe and feel... Perhaps its just nostalgia, but I can without a doubt say Mabi is the best MMORPG I've ever played- and I've played probably near to 100 since I was a child (which I was when I started playing this.)


To top it off- somehow the devs continue to support this game far more than you'd imagine a game 20~ years old would be getting- it regularly gets new content updates, entire storylines, new talents and skills and mechanics- infact the devs announced a couple years ago now that they were re-creating the entire game in Unreal engine 5, and from what they've shown off- its keeping quite true to the original style- which is incredible news considering when Nexon released their profits per game--- mabinogi raked in the least out of all their flagship titles... 

Anyways, highly recommend, if you want a friend to guide you through the game feel free to add me.

185479874.review: Pay to Win Nexon Game. Only saving grace is the community but besides that; it's truly a terrible experience.

185324570.review:
I cannot imagine my life without the influence of Mabinogi. I joined during G6. I think my favorite memory was rolling down Ciar dungeon with my friends, all of us around level 50. A mage, a warrior, and me the archer. I have a vivid recollection of sharing a joke i cant remember, but we all went silent travelling down a long straight hallway to Dungeon Theme 5, and just listened. A great time indeed. A lost time. Back when the streets of Dunbarton were filled with overpriced peddlers. The farmlands of Tallitean were sought after as valuable possessions. The entire continent of Iria all but a mystery to us. and Cichol, a character i found so fascinating i carried his image as every profile pic i could customize. to preserve those fond memories and honor my friends.

Some of my fondest childhood memories were made in this game. The three of us having a blast was an expectation after school. And I can happily say there isnt a moment i would take back to do anything else. 

There are many who start this game and end up not liking it. Thats fine, I wish the best to every Milletian who passes through Erinn. Thank you for trying my childhood out. Thank you for contributing to our journey.

I hope theres a remaster. I hope to God theres a remaster. 

In loving memory of Lucas. The bravest mage I ever knew.

185149350.review: I played this game a lot 10 years ago. I stopped for about 8 years and came back recently. The game was fun back then, but they've refined it now days. The crafting and job system used to be SUPER tedious. They have massively improved that. The story is deep and interesting.

185045679.review:
I've played this game on and off for the better part of the past decade. Don't let my hours count fool you, I used to open the client directly from the Nexon website back in the day. Not much more can be said than this game has been absolutely murdered in the name of convenience.

I won't go terribly into detail, because this game does offer SO MUCH for you to do. However, the best example I have is this: As a minor convenience, I decided to become a master musician with all instruments within the span of 30 minutes. 

While it's great that there's an opportunity for new characters (for both newbies and people just making another character) to be brought up to speed so they can play alongside those who have years more experience under their belt, I can't help but feel like the soul of this game was sacrificed in order to attain that.

In this game, you get better at something by doing it more. No duh, you say. What I mean is, in order to level up your various skills, you really had to work at it. While some games might have you level a skill simply by defeating enemies with it, this one had you complete mini challenges, giving the feeling that both you and your character were really learning how to better utilize that skill, and experimenting to see how far you both could take it.

So, it was a real investment to decide "I'm going to be the party mage/healer/tank/etc!"

But now, within an hour of starting your very first character, you can become a master, literally a master in title of each of those skills.

The game has other flaws, mainly due to being such an old game, but it's absolutely oozing with charm that makes you feel cool doing the hundreds of cool things offered to you. The game REALLY is what you make of it.

I just can't in good faith recommend this game anymore, because the thing I loved about it the most is just kinda gone.
